_header: In May when mirth moves upon loft
_description: A political prophecy — six irregular lines

BLCottTitAXXV.First Lines: In may when myrth moves vpon lofteAnd þe belende of Iune bene knytt all to geder…
BLCottTitAXXV.Last Lines: …And M M off thro yeres bene com to an endeAnd CCCC a deuce be cesset for ever
BLCottTitAXXV.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Poems Dealing with Contemporary Conditions.” 
             A Manual of the Writings in Middle English.
            Albert E. Hartung, ed. 
         Vol. 5, fascicle 13. New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and
            Sciences, 1975: 1385-1536, 1631-1725: 1533.
